required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Registry to Evaluate the Flexitouch System and Flexitouch Plus for Treatment of Head and Neck Lymphedema
clinical_study.official_title: A Registry to Evaluate the Flexitouch System and Flexitouch Plus for Treatment of Head and Neck Lymphedema

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of this registry is to evaluate the long term effectiveness of the Flexitouch System and Flexitouch Plus in those with head and neck lymphedema. This outcome data will include information regarding each subject's medical history, symptoms, quality of life, pain, range of motion (ROM), swelling, ease of use, treatment satisfaction, treatment compliance, and adverse events.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Changes between Baseline and 6 months will be assessed
primary_outcome.description: To evaluate symptoms based upon the EORTC HN35 questionnaire after 168 days (approximately 6 months) of treatment with the Flexitouch System or Flexitouch Plus

primary_outcome.time_frame: Changes between Baseline and 6 months will be assessed
primary_outcome.description: To evaluate function based upon cervical and shoulder range of motions measurements after 168 days (approximately 6 months) of treatment with the Flexitouch System or Flexitouch Plus

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in health-related Quality of Life
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Changes between Baseline and 1, 3, and 6 months will be assessed
secondary_outcome.description: Subject Quality of Life will be assessed using EORTC C30 questionnaire

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Changes between Baseline and 1, 3, and 6 months will be assessed
secondary_outcome.description: Pain will be assessed using the VAS Pain Scale

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Changes between Baseline and 1, 3, and 6 months will be assessed
secondary_outcome.description: Swelling will be assessed using the ALOHA measurement protocol

secondary_outcome.measure: Ease of Use and Treatment Satisfaction
secondary_outcome.description: Both Ease of Use and Treatment satisfaction will be assessed by survey

intervention.intervention_name: Flexitouch system with Head and Neck Garments
intervention.description: Flexitouch system or Flexitouch Plus Head and Neck Treatment, as prescribed

study_pop.textblock: Subjects diagnosed with Head and Neck Lymphedema and prescribed the Flexitouch system or Flexitouch Plus system as standard of care treatment

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age ≥ 18 years
- A diagnosis of head and/or neck lymphedema
- Must be able and willing to participate in all aspects of the registry and provide informed consent prior to registry participation
- Head and chest measurements within the following:
- Crown of head circumference: ≤ 72 cm
- Chest circumference: ≤ 158 cm
- Prescribed the Flexitouch system or Flexitouch Plus
Exclusion Criteria:
- Uncontrolled hyperthyroidism or parathyroidism (for which endocrinologist recommends against neck compression)
- Carotid sinus hypersensitivity syndrome
- Symptomatic carotid artery disease, as manifested by a recent transient ischemic attack (within 30 days), ischemic stroke, or amaurosis fugax (monocular visual ischemic symptoms or blindness)
- Symptomatic bradycardia in the absence of a pacemaker
- Internal jugular venous thrombosis (within 3 months)
- Increased intracranial pressure or other contraindications to internal or external jugular venous compression
- Acute radiation dermatitis, unhealed surgical scar, unhealed or open wound(s), or surgical flap less than 6-8 weeks post-operative
- Facial or head and neck dermal metastasis
- Acute facial infection (e.g., facial or parotid gland abscess)
- Any condition in which increased venous and lymphatic return is undesirable
- Heart failure (acute pulmonary edema, decompensated acute heart failure)
- Subject is pregnant or trying to become pregnant
- Acute venous disease (acute thrombophlebitis, acute deep venous thrombosis, acute pulmonary embolism)
